content.text: Measure and record the distance \(L\) between the two nails
Attach the crocodile clip to the string so that the string passes through the gap between the jaws of the crocodile clip, as shown in Fig. 1.2
Measure and record \(d\)
Measure and record the initial height \(h_0\) of the bottom of the mass above the bench, as shown in Fig. 1.3

Reduce \(d\) by moving the crocodile clip closer to the plumb-line, ensuring that the string passes through the gap as shown in Fig. 1.2. Measure and record \(d\) and the new height \(h\) of the bottom of the mass above the bench. Repeat until you have six sets of values for \(d\) and \(h\), with \(d\) in the range \(5\mathrm{cm}\) to \(30\mathrm{cm}\)
Include values of \(\left(\frac{L}{2} - d\right)^2\) and \((h - h_0)\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\left(\frac{L}{2} - d\right)^2\) on the \(y\)-axis against \((h - h_0)\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
The relationship between \(d\) and \(h\) is
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Using your answers from (d)(iii), determine the values of \(a\) and \(b\). Give appropriate units
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium position of a suspended mass
The apparatus has been set up as shown in Fig. 1.1
You have been provided with two plastic rulers, one with a loop of string attached. Take the ruler without string and clamp it along the edge of the bench with a flat face uppermost
Use some of the Blu-Tack to make a ball of diameter about \(8 \text{mm}\)
Using the calipers provided, measure and record the diameter of the ball
ball diameter =

Place the ball of Blu-Tack on the clamped ruler with a thin rod each side of it. Press the flat face of the second ruler on to the Blu-Tack until the ruler touches the rods. The Blu-Tack will form a disc, as shown in Fig. 2.1
Measure and record the diameter \(d\) of the disc of Blu-Tack
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in \(d\)
percentage uncertainty = .........
Calculate the contact area \(A\) using \(A = \frac{\pi d^2}{4}\)
Attach the newton-meter to the string loop and lay it horizontally on the bench
Pull the newton-meter horizontally (parallel to the rulers). Measure and record the force \(F\) when the top ruler detaches
Remove the Blu-Tack from the rulers
Make a ball with a slightly different diameter and repeat (a)(iii), (a)(iv), (b)(i), (b)(iii) and (c)
You should be aware that a large change in diameter could result in a reading outside the range of the newton-meter
ball diameter = .........
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\)
first value of \(k =\)
second value of \(k =\)
Explain whether your results support the suggested relationship
It is suggested that the relationship between \(F\) and \(A\) is
where \(k\) is a constant
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
Describe four improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
In this experiment, you will investigate the adhesive strength of Blu-Tack
